By James Clay

By James Clay

By James Clay

Plans for future investment in housing and infrastructure are being debated by the local council

UCU strikes stood down

By Gracie Daw

Action on 21, 22, 23, 27, 28 February and 1 and 2 March will not go ahead

Pierrick Roger re-elected as YUSU President

YUSU Election Results 2023

By James Clay

Pierrick Roger re-elected as YUSU President

Internationally successful Virtual Learning Environment rejected by University of York

A Goodricke College first-year student has created a Virtual Learning Environment (VLE) to rival Yorkshare VLE, which has thus far been denied by the University

First JCRC Chairs revealed

The first results for the JCRC elections 2009 have been announced

YUSU conflict over porters

YUSU remain split in their decision to continue campaigning against the portering cuts

University fails to warn students about "disgusting" drain works

The University have been criticised for the failure to inform students about the extent of work being done on the campus drainage system

Langwith Punch banned

Langwith College Provost, John Issitt, has this week banned the traditional weekly Langwith Punch event after last week's session "got completely out of hand"

Sudden spate of bike thefts on campus

Another four bikes have been stolen on campus in the last seven days, bringing the total number of bikes that have been reported stolen to 35

York Come Dancing

Peter warner-medley and his parter Abigail Wilson were announced the winning couple of York Come Dancing on Sunday (Thumbnail credit Justyn Hardcastle)

'York Come Dancing' - Live

<em>Nouse</em> and <em>YSTV</em> have joined forces once again to bring you coverage of 'York Come Dancing' - live

University of York saddened by death of student in car accident

A third year University of York student has died after being involved in a car accident in the early hours of Sunday morning

'York Come Dancing' contestants name Gruff Jones "favourite to win"

Competition for 'York Come Dancing' seems to be heating up following a brief press conference at last night's rehearsals

York triumphant at Guardian Student Media Awards

<em>Nouse</em> was awarded the prize for Best Student Website of the year at last night's annual Guardian Student Media Awards

Prestigious Guardian award won by University students

Students from the University of York were last night awarded a prestigious Guardian Public Services Award

Clothes of missing Chemistry student found by the River Ouse

The North Yorkshire Police are currently investigating the disappearance of a 4th year undergraduate Chemistry student from the University of York

Two more unidentified men found in Derwent

Another two unidentified men were found in an unlocked bedroom in Derwent College B block last night after yet another gross lapse in Derwent security (Thumbnail credit Rachel Elgar)

YUSU Election Results

YUSU Election Results Below are results for the recent YUSU elections. Voting closed on 21 November.

Tom Eleftheriades Memorial Service

A memorial service to celebrate the life of Tom Eleftheriades, a 2nd year Vanbrugh College student who died suddenly during fresher's week, is to take place tomorrow, Saturday 21st November

University rejects YUSU portering campaign

The Student Services committee has rejected a YUSU run campaign and its proposal to reinstate 24 hour portering across campus, declaring that new infrastructure for security and welfare will be an adequate replacement for 24/7 portering (Thumbnail credit Photograph by George Lowther)

YUSU election candidates announced

Voting for the YUSU Elections is open until Saturday 21 November

Vandals strike Heslington East area

Three cases of vandalism to cars parked on Field Lane on Tuesday 17th November are currently being investigated by the North Yorkshire Police

Claudia message a 'sick hoax'

A Facebook message which appeared this week, claiming to be from missing chef Claudia Lawrence, has been dismissed as almost certainly a "sick hoax" by friends and family

ISA by-election results

The results for the ISA elections were announced this morning

Second homeless person found in Derwent

Another unidentified homeless man has been found inside student accommodation in Derwent College this week after a separate incident just days before

YUSU to campaign against portering cuts

A mandate was passed at a Campaigns Committee on Wednesday night regarding YUSU's decision to protest against the current lack of 24-hour portering

Formerly disgraced candidate wins GSA presidency despite lacklustre campaign

Rui Huang won the race to become the new Graduate Student Association (GSA) despite failing to make an appearance at the election, and spending little effort on his campaign. (Thumbnail credit JASON LOZIER)

Student attacked by gang after leaving campus event

An Alcuin first-year student was assaulted by four fellow students whilst heading home after the campus event, Rave D. (Thumbnail credit JASON LOZIER)

Former University Head of Security secures consultancy role with Hes East contractor

A Former Senior University Employee whose position was dissolved during the recent changes to the campus portering service has been employed on a consultancy basis for a firm contracted by the University. (Thumbnail credit ALLY CARMICHAEL)

Fusion hope for record 2009

usion President Cesca Dessain has announced that this year's show will be larger and include more students than ever before. (Thumbnail credit JUSTYN HARDCASTLE)

Disabled students left without vital equipment

Disabled students at the University of York are "in dire need" of basic equipment to allow them to study.

Further welfare issues arise as portering reductions continue

The university's commitment to student welfare has again been brought into question as reductions in the University's portering hours have left students isolated.

Celebrity lecturer cancels after University antagonism

Dr Ben Goldacre, author of Bad Science, has cancelled a lecture following the University's insistence that he fill in an expenses form.

Internationally successful Virtual Learning Environment rejected by University of York

A Goodricke College first-year student has created a Virtual Learning Environment (VLE) to rival Yorkshare VLE, which has thus far been denied by the University

First JCRC Chairs revealed

The first results for the JCRC elections 2009 have been announced

YUSU conflict over porters

YUSU remain split in their decision to continue campaigning against the portering cuts

University fails to warn students about "disgusting" drain works

The University have been criticised for the failure to inform students about the extent of work being done on the campus drainage system

Langwith College Provost, John Issitt, has this week banned the traditional weekly Langwith Punch event after last week's session "got completely out of hand"

Another four bikes have been stolen on campus in the last seven days, bringing the total number of bikes that have been reported stolen to 35

Peter warner-medley and his parter Abigail Wilson were announced the winning couple of York Come Dancing on Sunday (Thumbnail credit Justyn Hardcastle)
